data.text: @Bikery1966 @Pinarello_Pete @timegerton3 @commuteroo Thankfully the environment and violence of glider flying, especially with a winch launch and in African monster thermals, means that I never had any problems with who was in control. Gliders are generally not the gentle floaty thing many people imagine. :)

@MikeyCycling @Pinarello_Pete @timegerton3 @commuteroo Ahh the odd cockpit gradient it can be a nightmare, I had to check out a an ex RAF ex Airline writer of flying manuals on a 60mph biplane I was dead relaxed right up until the point I had to take control and sort the unusual attitude 10 ft from the ground and trees! 😳
@timegerton3 @Pinarello_Pete @Bikery1966 Aye. Tis nice to see a happy positive thread today. Well done folks.
@MikeyCycling @Pinarello_Pete @Bikery1966 @commuteroo When I was a boy there was a gliding club near Nympsfield that used a Tiger Moth to take the gliders up sadly it was lost in a fire

@Pinarello_Pete @timegerton3 @Bikery1966 @commuteroo Here's me, 17/18, flying the BA flight staff recreation club glider that our gliding club kept for them. I was often P1 over 747 captains who came out to fly with us. LMAO!!! https://t.co/3y6YcL9mVE

@Bikery1966 @commuteroo @timegerton3 Hahaha. My mate took me up in a C152 out of Barton several years ago - he admired how accurately I climbed out nailed at 60kts. He wasn’t quite as impressed when I flared at 20ft….🤣
@timegerton3 @Pinarello_Pete @commuteroo You’re welcome it’s like talking bikes I could chat all day

@Pinarello_Pete @commuteroo @timegerton3 Sat at the threshold in a Land Rover at Linton watching a Jet2 737 Capt we’d sent solo in a Grob/Vigilant round out at 50ft for his first 3 approaches til he got used to flying with his arse nearer the ground 😂
@timegerton3 @Bikery1966 @commuteroo Fire any questions you have Tim, I’m in Costa having a lazy coffee…👍
